speaker: Stonebridge
line: Old stone arches over a river that runs too fast for its width. Cracks spiderweb the keystone, as if the bridge is holding itself together out of pride.

speaker: Stonemason Mirka
line: Don’t stomp. I can hear the stress lines. If this thing fails, it won’t be dramatic—it’ll be quiet, and then you’ll be gone.

speaker: Stonemason Mirka
line: A soulstone would help. Not because it’s magic—because it’s stubborn. Stone respects that kind of will.

speaker: River-Sound
line: Below, water hisses along the broken pilings. The bridge doesn’t feel unsafe. It feels tired.

choices.text: I’ll return when I can help.
